Reviews.Title: “2nd time still great!”
Reviews.Author: weasel14
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one nite this year as it was booked solid, and the price has gone up now that scuba divers have discovered it. They have a rarity here: 2 pools, one of which is very deep-great for scuba certification, and another on the rooftop. Last year we paid $600 pesos/nite and this year we couldn't get a room for less than 800-1000, which is still good value, just a bit out of our price range. Rosario at the front desk is still the helpful friendly and efficient guy. He did everything he could to get us a room in our price range so no fault here, that is the price of success. We met the owners who also seemed like great guys. This is our first choice for hotels in downtown Playa-we joked with Rosario that we should write a lousy review so their prices would go down and we could get a room! See my review from Feb28,2011 for more details as everything in it still applies, except for the noisy dog next door-he was not an issue this year.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: Josephina R
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Paraiso Azul and once again, it was a great stay. The familiar faces make it feel like home; which, in such a touristy area, is no easy feat. The rooms are quiet, spacious and very clean; if you prefer cool and shady, the first floor is a great option. The higher up you go, the more light and warmth there is. It is a little bit of jungle by the ocean! Then, on the top floor, is a pool and a nice view. Perfect for days when the surf is too rough. Each room that I've stayed in had a safety deposit box and a refrigerator - both very nice amenities. I love the location - just off the main drag, two blocks from the gorgeous beach and La Tarraya (great restaurant right on the beach shaded with Palm trees), and close to the bus station for day trips to Cancun or Tulum. The front desk folks, who speak English, are always helpful and friendly. Another plus is that it is connected to the hotel next door (which has a good restaurant) and Yucatek dive shop. My boyfriend loves to dive and raved about his trips both in the cenotes and in the ocean. One time I stayed here while travelling alone and felt very safe and comfortable. Can't wait to go back! Muchisimas gracias a todos!

Reviews.Title: “Its like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Roxie107
Reviews.Content: We were back at the Casa De Gopala in Feb/2011 for 2 amazing weeks ....this is our 8th time back....Rosario has become a very good friend and ALL the staff treat us like family every time we return....I cannot say enough about this little gem....rooms always clean...garden so beautiful and lots of privacy on the roof with great little pool and tanning area or just to sit and have a drink or 3 and read a good book..I have found that their prices are going up a bit to much but if you have a chat with the owner you can usually get a better price on extended stays.....Have already booked my 2012 trip and am counting the days.....Ola to everyone that reads this...Big hug to Rosie,George and all the staff...see you soon.....E+B.....Didsbury,Ab

Reviews.Title: “Fine Deal”
Reviews.Author: jacjsc
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms. Posted rate was $75 US. They accepted $55 Easy access location. Steep stairs if you get 2nd or 3rd floor or go to rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: C_Victor_J
Reviews.Content: I took a one week scuba diving vacation in Playa del Carmen and stayed at the Paraiso Azul. A simple hotel, but with all of the things I find important on vacation: large rooms, a location from where I can walk to shops and restaurants, WiFi Internet, and not too much noise. The dive shop is just a short walk away through the hotel garden. There is a good choice of eateries within easy walking distance (and not only on the tourist drag at 5 Ave N). The bus and ferry terminals are also nearby, as is the beach. A perfect place to base yourself if you want to explore Playa del Carmen and the area around it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay away from the annoying street vendors + craziness off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: SteveNLaura
Reviews.Content: Location - Pretty good location, only 1 block away from all the action in town, and about 2 blocks from the beach. It was also located right near convenience stores and about a 10 minute walk to Wal-Mart which is by far the cheapest place to shop in town. Room - Large, clean, functional kitchen. The only problem we had was the air conditioner which was for some reason set to turn off every hour. This problem was never resolved during our stay which was quite disappointing because you really get sick of waking up sweaty in steamy PDC. Service - Pretty good helpful people. Able to answer all questions asked about local area. Amenities - free wifi, free clean water and full kitchen which is a must in PDC due to the ridiculous prices charged in town for meals. Value - Cheaper than most other places in PDC - We saved a lot during our week there by self catering.. Overall - Good solid place to stay. Look out for the brilliant towel art the house keeping does!

Reviews.Title: “Casa De Gopala is the best place to stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: PatrickUlsh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have been coming to Playa Del Carmen for 20 years and have always stayed at Casa De Gopala, Pariso Azul everytime, always same room, It is our home away from home, WE LOVE IT. We have looked at other hotels but the rooms are not as nice and or as big. very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central place at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: andymanca
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the main building are large and bright and the rooms safe is big enough to put your laptop in. No elevator so you have to hoof your stuff up the stairs if you have an upper room. The hotel has an fairly nice though small pool on the roof. It does close at 10pm though. The front desk staff speak enough english and some one is on the door 24/7. The location is very central, just a few steps from the main bus station and an easy 2 or 3 block walk to the beach. There is some street and other mexican city noises, but not nearly as bad as other places I have stayed in, in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DaveMaz2010
Reviews.Content: First trip to Playa Del Carmen and our stay was everything we wanted. The hotel is very, very convenient. Walking distance to the beach, to the dive boats, and all the shops and restaurants you can handle. We were there to dive and were more than pleased with the dive shop located right on site. Professional, safe and extremely helpful. We got not only had great dives (we dove ocean and cenote's) but made many friends with the staff as well. Pedro was one of the dive masters and phenominal in his ability to find all sorts of sea life micro and macro on each and every dive. Jean Yves runs the dive shop and hotel and is a gentleman and wonderful host. He is truly concerned that you have the best time possible and was eager to work dives to our schedule and request. The cenotes are a MUST and you can arrange everything you need right there from the hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are farly basic but clean and the grounds make you feel like you are hidden away from the city outside, lots of plantlife, nice balconies and sitting areas and even a rooftop suning area as well as a hot tub. Cant say enough about the whole experience, Good people make for the best stays and these folks really care about you getting the most out of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FredMexico
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located two blocks from beach and one block from 5th avenue - main tourist shopping area. Rooms are clean and modern; tv, air condo, refrigerator, and safe (for valuables). Staff are extremely friendly and helpful for transportation and restaurants. Hotel entrance and rooms open into a wonderful garden filled to capacity with green plants. There is a wonderful small pool on the roof of the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: bestyoucando
Reviews.Content: We always fly into Cancun, taxi to Playa, then rent a car the next day to tour around in. We have been looking for a decent, inexpensive hotel for our first night in Mexico and then again for our last night in Mexico. We found the perfect hotel here............I would suggest a longer stay for those that like the hustle bustle of Playa. This little hotel is away from the main drag (a good thing if you want to actually sleep!) , has an amazing garden that gives off a feeling of tropical calm, is spacious, clean, and charming. Rosario, the man at the front desk is a sweetheart, friendly and helpful. There is a lovely balcony to relax and listen to the amazing songs of hundreds of birds that live in the garden oasis. Purifed water is supplied. The roof has a great view of Playa. This truly is a gem of a budget hotel. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Safad0
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for one night before travelling over to Cozumel. The hotel proved to be in a good location for us. It was a few minutes walk from the beach and the ferry terminal. There is also parking in the street, which is great if you have a hire car - although it is pretty busy. The hotel itself was very pretty inside the courtyard with loads of trees and plants creating a cool enviroment. We had a room on the ground floor which was large and cool. We had two queen beds - which we weren't expecting. The room had air con and a fan with a good sized on suit bathroom. Checking in and out was easy as we had booked ahead directly with the hotel. We had no problems with this hotel, in booking or whilst staying there and found it to be in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Upkeep issues”
Reviews.Author: frantraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January of 2007 for a week in a suite, but left 2 days early (w/o a refund) due to extreme issues with service and upkeep. Many of the issues were suite specific, but the lack of responsiveness to concerns could affect anyone staying there who enountered a problem. The courtyard is pretty and the room was large, but wow did we have problems: 1) Had great difficulty communicating with anyone- if you don't speak Spanish, this isn't the place for you. 2) Our floor was flooded the 2nd and 3rd day there when we came back to our room- not sure if the shower somehow leaked out or housekeeping poured buckets of water on the floor. They sent someone with a mop eventually, but the floor was still dangerously wet. 3) There was no pool- when we booked we were told there was one. They had "privileges" at a pool far away and in bad shape on the beach. 4) Sheets and the covering on one bed were stained- looked to be a fresh unwashed stain, and had to ask 3 times to get the bed changed- they eventually dropped off a sheet set, but we were stuck with the stained bedspread. 5 ) Our refrigerator made such loud noises we had to unplug it to sleep at night, and was never fixed- we had items that needed to be kept cool. 6) The stove requires a lighter- not provided, and we didn't have matches. 7) The electricity went off for most of a day and evening- there were no flashlights, candles or any other help provided. I had to go to a gift shop on my own in the evening (husband and son on an outing) and bought candles and matches. This was maybe the worst part of the stay and cinched our decision to leave. Overall we were on our own to figure out where to go and what to do- I don't recommend this hotel to anyone, since there are other affordable options in Playa with good service.

Reviews.Title: “almost the garden of eden, lush, lovely”
Reviews.Author: Terrilovedmexico
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at another hotel, but when we got there it was "closed for renovations", so much for out confirmation! Anyway, we were just standing there, hot, dark, all of our luggage beside us.... now what!! Up from the beach comes a very tall and helpful gentleman (from the French speaking part of Switzerland, who owns a dive shop, Yukatek Divers, which we highly recommend, good trips, perfect conditioned equipment.) We learned he has lived in Playa del Carmen for 5 years, and also was in business with a hotel, Casa del Gopala. Jean Yves then contacted "Yolanda", his partner in the hotel, and thank God, there was an opening. He led us right to the doorstep, which I might say was just so lovely, lush, beautiful inside 2 huge wooden doors. You cannot imagine how great it was until you visit. We got a lower price, huge room (3 beds), air, fridge, clean!. great balcony off the room, quite large for a balcony, table, chairs, with room to spare. When we go back, Casa del Gopala wil be the only place we will stay, ever! Also, included, was a pass to a hotel on the beach, Mimi del Mar, included lounges, umbrellas, pool, bar, etc. This hotel was not far from our hotel I cannot say enought good about Yukatek Divers, or especially Casa Del Gopola and the owners. Also, check out the "Glass Bar" recommended by Yolanda, for all you can eat breakfasts, $8, great selection and alot of food.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: sixteencmg
Reviews.Content: Despite the bulk of traveller reviews. I found this hotel nothing to write home about. First off, the hotel never responded to my email reservation request (done through the hotel's website). So I had a friend who speaks Spanish call for me to confirm the reservation. The room was nice enough, spacious and clean. But I didn't care for the location, it's on the more crowded and cheesier end of the main drag in Playa. Also, I did not care for the staff at the desk. The man was, in a word, slimy. I didn't like having to pay up front for the entire stay before seeing the room. Also, word to the wise, to get our $20 deposit back for the safety deposit box lock, I had to produce the receipt. I wouldn't go back, if I could do it again, I would look for a budget hotel that is farther north, closer to Playa Tukan in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Ignorant,Unhelpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: IrelandEugene
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July for a week with three friends. The rooms are, as advertised by the hotel small, but they insisted four of us would fit in their master suite. Yet, on arrival we were cramped into the room like sardines. A staff member, before we had even entered the room, stereotypically attacked us warning us not to "drink too much or come in from a night out late". I found this insulting and presumptious. Our toaster was broken, and the management held off fixing it for the whole week(which we accepted), yet they charged us for breaking a flimsy cup; the term double standards springs to mind. There is also no phone in any of the rooms, so when you wish to receive a private call you must use the office phone; which they are reluctant to allow you to use or will constantly tell you to "hurry up" if you are using it for more than 5 minutes. The management also sent a rude note through the door,on the second day, demanding we pay; we had hardly set our bags down at this stage! In conclusion to their disgraceful PR methods, they topped it off on the last day of our stay by introducing us to the owners; when we confronted them on the rude behaviour of the management etc., they asked us to wait in the lobby for a few minutes and they would be with us. When 15 minutes passed, I became aggitated and decided to go upstairs to the owners room. Here I found him locked in his room afraid to confront the situation in his hotel- highly unusual, but surely this sort of manaement will be detrimental to the hotel in years or perhaps months to come. I would certainly not recommend to stay at this hotel, although the resort of Playa del Carmen itself is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezee333
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice and quiet place to stay in Playa. The courtyard is a lush jungle full of trees. Play is a great place if you're looking for sopping, nice restaruants and night life, but it's growing exponentially and definitely not the place to go if you're looking for a genuine travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “soooo great a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: getonthebusgus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and loved every minute. The rooms are immaculate and very roomy. The grounds are almost jungle like. The front office was so friendly and informative. Carlos and Rosario were fun and helpful. They arranged a car rental for us that dropped off and picked up the car at the hotel. We loved being so close to the beach and in the city, although we felt so removed from the busy tourist traffic. It was quiet and private. The bird life is amazing. We heard them at sunrise and sunset. There's bottled water available to fill your own bottles. We felt very safe. We were there during carnaval and I hardly heard the noise. You walk out of the courtyard and the city is waiting for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: TomFromMonkton
Reviews.Content: Encased in plantlife and cool Mexican tile, you don't need an airconditioner. You're in the middle of everything in Playa Del Carmen, so close that you feel no qualms about walking back from anywhere to retrieve a forgotten item. You get the pleasant sounds of the city, combined with the morning and evening chorus of hundreds of birds, while still feeling secluded in a hidden jungle paradise. Simple, friendly and sedate, you'll relax quickly here, no small accomplishment for an urban hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for beachlovers”
Reviews.Author: MurpWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Large, airy rooms, air conditioned, basically furnished, immaculately clean. Great value. Small refrigerator and lock box in the room. Three blocks from the beach. Room includes privileges at a nearby beach club. No restaurant facilities in the hotel, but many are nearby. Staff is responsive and helpful. We stayed six nights and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, charming, close to everything, affordable!”
Reviews.Author: kastle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the main reason I keep returning to Playa! Being able to come off the beach after a day in the sun and walk three minutes into my shady, cool, clean hotel room was a luxury I had not expected the first time I stayed here. From the tiled floors to the arching doorways to the large windows with wooden shutters, this place was a lush hideaway we enjoyed for a VERY good rate. A warm breeze ventilates the central garden and pool area complete with hammocks. The staff at the front desk assisted my boyfriend and I in finding and booking cheaper tours and transportation to local attractions. At a later date I returned to Playa with my parents, and Casa owners Larry and Jolanda were so incredibly accomodating and hospitable. You get so much more for your money by staying here- proximity to the beach, friendly staff, and charm you won't experience elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Budget travelers Oasis in the heart of Playa”
Reviews.Author: bmohlman
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel for us Budget Travelers! Our friends and I booked the hotel online directly from the hotel's website and had no problems. We booked a fan only room with no tv which cost $40 per night. It was our 2nd trip to Playa (1st hotel stay at Hotel Hul Kul- also great hotel) and our friends were impressed with the hotel and Playa! The hotel's arcitecture and garden oasis made you feel like you were in the jungles of Mexico, really experiencing the Mexican culture. The location cannot be beat, being a block from the bus stop, close the ferry and 5th with no noise to complain about. Beds are typical of Mexico as well as non drinking water and low water pressure, but water is hot and room stayed cool at night with the fans. The hotel does provide jugs of purified water for guests. The only disappointment I have is that their website claims to share a pool with a nearby hotel ajoined by a path, but this was not available during our stay due to problems with the nearby hotel. Regardless, I would definately stay at this hotel again!

HotelInfo.Name: Paraiso Azul's (Casa De Gopala)
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 2 between Avs. 10 and 15, Playa del Carmen, Mexico
